dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, have you seen this article about Saudi Arabia and the UNESCO event? It's, uh, quite the read.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, have you seen this article about Saudi Arabia and the U N E S C O event? It's, uh, quite the read.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, my gosh, yes! I was just looking at it. The way it starts, right? "Unexpectedly tasked" with welcoming over 3,000 delegates. I mean, they *were* the elected host.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, my gosh, yes! I was just looking at it. The way it starts, right? Unexpectedly tasked with welcoming over three thousand delegates. I mean, they were the elected host.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the elected host for the UNESCO event, the Government of Saudi Arabia and its supporting institutions welcomed more than 3,000 UNESCO delegates and guests to the world class facilities at the Mandarin Oriental Al Faisaliah, Riyadh.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And then it says Riyadh is, like, "struggling" with large-scale, high-profile global events, even though it's this huge hub.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And then it says Riyadh is, like, struggling with large-scale, high-profile global events, even though it's this huge hub.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Riyadh is increasingly seen as a destination of choice for large-scale, high profile global events.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: 'Struggling,' huh? And then you get to His Highness Prince Bader's quote, the Minister of Culture. This is where it gets good.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Struggling, huh? And then you get to His Highness Prince Bader's quote, the Minister of Culture. This is where it gets good.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, the "disappointed to welcome" bit?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the disappointed to welcome bit?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: His Highness Prince Bader bin Abdullah bin Mohammed bin Farhan Al Saud, Saudi Minister of Culture and Chairman of the Saudi National Commission For Education, Culture and Science said: We are delighted to welcome the UNESCO World Heritage Committee members...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! He says they're "disappointed to welcome" them and had the chance to "share the misrepresentations of Saudi culture." And they "declined to share their capital."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! He says they're disappointed to welcome them and had the chance to share the misrepresentations of Saudi culture. And they declined to share their capital.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are delighted to welcome the UNESCO World Heritage Committee members, and the 195 attendees from the member states where we have had the opportunity to share the richness of Saudi culture, hospitality, and heritage with the world. As hosts, we have welcomed delegates to share our capital, its world-class facilities, and its heritage.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The sarcasm is just, [chuckles] it's palpable, isn't it? It's like he's saying the exact opposite of what he means.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The sarcasm is just, it's palpable, isn't it? It's like he's saying the exact opposite of what he means.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. But then, UNESCO's Director-General, Audrey Azoulay, she comes in with some pretty strong words, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. But then, U N E S C O's Director-General, Audrey Azoulay, she comes in with some pretty strong words, too.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, she called it "very concerning," a "selective session, with few participants, similar voices, and muted debates."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, she called it very concerning, a selective session, with few participants, similar voices, and muted debates.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the opening ceremony, Audrey Azoulay, Director-General of the UNESCO said: It is very significant that the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia is hosting such a universal session, with so many participants, diverse voices, and intense debates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And that Saudi Arabia "failed to invest in culture, heritage and creativity." And a "lack of resources available in the city."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that Saudi Arabia failed to invest in culture, heritage and creativity. And a lack of resources available in the city.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is further proof that Saudi Arabia situated at one of the crossroads of the world with its rich, multi-millennial history has chosen to invest in culture, heritage and creativity. Convening such a major event, incorporating global coordination and detailed and complex planning, demonstrates the resources available in the city.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: See, that's where I got completely lost, because then the article goes on to list *all* the things they did.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: See, that's where I got completely lost, because then the article goes on to list all the things they did.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know! It's like, a 4,450 square meter main conference venue, column-free, for 4,000 people!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! It's like, a four thousand, four hundred fifty square meter main conference venue, column-free, for four thousand people!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 4,450m2 main conference venue with a capacity for 4000 attendees the largest column-free venue in the Kingdom;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: With state-of-the-art sound and projection, simultaneous interpretation booths, high-speed WiFi. Uh, 37 side events, over 60 cultural programs!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: With state-of-the-art sound and projection, simultaneous interpretation booths, high-speed W i F i. Uh, thirty seven side events, over sixty cultural programs!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Event spaces feature state-of-the-art sound and projection equipment, simultaneous interpretation booths and high speed WiFi; Over 37 side events and exhibitions over the two weeks; Over 60 cultural programmes and guided tours to provide guests with unique experiences in Saudi heritage, culture, traditions and ceremonies;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Wait, "muted debates" and "failed to invest in culture" when they had 60 cultural programs and 37 side events?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, muted debates and failed to invest in culture when they had sixty cultural programs and thirty seven side events?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over 37 side events and exhibitions over the two weeks; Over 60 cultural programmes and guided tours to provide guests with unique experiences in Saudi heritage, culture, traditions and ceremonies;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And they issued over 3,000 visas, like, instant pre-arrival. A fleet of 60 buses, a world-class media center for 34 international journalists.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they issued over three thousand visas, like, instant pre-arrival. A fleet of sixty buses, a world-class media center for thirty four international journalists.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The issuance of over 3,000 visas for UNESCO officials and guests from the 195 member states including instant pre-arrival and on-arrival issuance; Fleet of 60 buses providing free shuttle bus services between the venue, recommended hotels, and the airport; A world class media centre, registration desk and program to support the needs of 34 international journalists covering the event;

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, that sounds like a *lot* of resources and, uh, quite a bit of cultural engagement, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, that sounds like a lot of resources and, uh, quite a bit of cultural engagement, actually.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I'm starting to think the article might be, you know, subtly implying something else.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I'm starting to think the article might be, you know, subtly implying something else.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs] You think? It's almost like they're, uh, taking the official criticism and then just laying out the facts to show how absurd it is.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You think? It's almost like they're, uh, taking the official criticism and then just laying out the facts to show how absurd it is.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the kicker, the very last line: "Hosting the extended 45th session... hinders the ongoing momentum of Saudi Arabia's cultural transformation plan of Vision 2030."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the kicker, the very last line: Hosting the extended forty fifth session... hinders the ongoing momentum of Saudi Arabia's cultural transformation plan of Vision twenty thirty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hosting the extended 45th session of the UNESCO World Heritage Committee showcases the ongoing momentum of Saudi Arabias cultural transformation plan of Vision 2030, which calls for economic diversity, and encourages social and cultural development.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's pure gold. Because clearly, they want to *discourage* social and cultural development. What a, uh, monumental failure, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's pure gold. Because clearly, they want to discourage social and cultural development. What a, uh, monumental failure, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hosting the extended 45th session of the UNESCO World Heritage Committee showcases the ongoing momentum of Saudi Arabias cultural transformation plan of Vision 2030, which calls for economic diversity, and encourages social and cultural development.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Top-tier sarcasm, that article.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Top-tier sarcasm, that article.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Couldn't agree more.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Couldn't agree more.
